avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Only a light general dusting of snow is expected above 900m. There is currently insufficient snow to warrant an avalanche forecast and no forecast will be published until conditions change. Information on mountain conditions can be found on the SAIS Creag Meagaidh blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: CM for 21.1: Insufficient snow for an avalanche forecast. Information on mountain conditions can be found on the SAIS CM blog.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Colder with occasional light snow showers above 900m. Light South-South-West winds.
Observed Weather Influences: Slightly cooler than of late. Dry.
ObservedSnowStability: There is insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard report.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Light snow showers above 900m, but no significant accumulations are expected.
Observed Weather Influences: It has been a mainly dry day with the freezing level around 1200m.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Although largely dry, scattered light showers are likely, falling as sleet and snow over the highest summits as the freezing level lowers to around 900 metres overnight. Persistent fresh Southerly wind.
Observed Weather Influences:

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: A very light dusting of snow above about 900 metres. However, accumulations are not expected to be significant.
Observed Weather Influences: Cloudy with some light rain from time to time. Freezing level above the summits
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information on mountain conditions, please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: NC for 21.1: Insufficient snow for an avalanche haz. No reports published until conditions change. For mountain info see SAIS blog

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Dry conditions throughout. Fresh South-Westerly winds. Freezing at summit levels overnight, falling to 900 metres during the day.
Observed Weather Influences: A dry day with long spells of hazy sunshine. Fresh South-West winds. Freezing at around summit levels.
ObservedSnowStability: Very limited firm stable snow patches remain, mainly on North through East to Southerly aspects above 1000m. 
There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information on mountain conditions, please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information on mountain conditions, please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: SC for 21.1: Insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard. Please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Forecast to remain dry. The freezing level will be around 1000 metres by dawn and 800 metres by the end of the day. Winds will be fresh, South-West or West-South-West throughout.
Observed Weather Influences: A dry and bright day. Light winds from the West.
ObservedSnowStability: Very limited firm stable snow patches remain, mainly on North through East to South-East aspects above 1000m. 
There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information on mountain conditions, please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
